div.pre: 147 Arta (anc. Ambracia), Epirus, c. 1929 (69, 466) Burial: 280 B.C. Contents: 60+ AR. Pot hoard Philip II: c. 33 tetrob. Acarnania: 3 st.; 1 dr. Anactorium: 1 st. Leucas: 2 st. Corinth: 18 st.; 2 dr. Disposition: O. Ravel part; New York ?* Ravel, NNM 52 (1932), pp. 12-27, illus.; TINC, p. 106 * The hoard of 21 posthumous tetrob. of Philip II acquired by Newell from an American dealer in 1932 (Noe 466) may well come from the Arta find. All coins (19 Amphipolis and 2 Pella) are in the same excellent condition as Ravel's material from Arta
